item.description:
This Meetup is part 1 of a 4 part series happening each Monday in March on:

How to get more content and more eyeballs on your web site

Everybody with a website wants more relevant eyeballs to their web site.

And nothing will get more and better readers/visitors to your site than good content and participation on your site.

Of course, those readers can convert to more paying clients.

The 4 topics in this series are:

  1. 5 ways to get legitimate back links to your site and why you should
  2. 5 ways to recruit guest bloggers/writers for your site
  3. 5 steps to take to get more comments/reader interaction on your blog/web site
  4. 10 most important SEO considerations for each post

This is a FREEMIUM-style Meetup.

What that means is anyone is welcome to attend the presentation for free.

To stick around for Q & A you must be a member of BillBelew.com/subscribe

www.billbelew.com/subscribe <= click thru

There will be a pause in the Meetup for non-members to leave or join to stay around.

This series is given by problogger, Bill Belew. Bill has has more than 10 different niche topics EACH with more than 1 million unique visitors. His students have reproduced his results and he is currently teaching an MBA course at university in Silicon Valley on how to do the same.
item.how_to_find_us: PACC is a church. The parking lot is dark. There is dimly lit brown and white sign that says Church of Christ and a Korean sign next to that.
item.name: 5 ways to get legitimate back links to your site and why you should- Part 1 of 4
